1 /* Libraries */
2 #include "ros/ros.h"
3 #include "miro_teleop/MonteCarlo.h"
4 #include <cstdio>
5 #include <cmath>
6 #include <map>
7 #include <boost/random.hpp>
8 #include <boost/random/normal_distribution.hpp>
9 #include <boost/random/uniform_real_distribution.hpp>
10 
11 /* Constants */
12 #define HSIZE 400 // Horizontal map size (in cm)
13 #define VSIZE 400 // Vertical map size (in cm)
14 #define RES 40 // Grid resolution
15 #define PERT_THRESH 0.5 // Minimum acceptable output pertinence
16 #define LIMIT 10000 // Limit simulation rounds (timeout constraint)
17 
27 int quantize(float x, float xmin, float xmax, float quantum)
28 {
29  int n = ceil((xmax-xmin)/quantum);
30  int posOrigin = ceil(n/2.0)-1;
31  float delta = 0;
32  if (n%2 != 0) delta = quantum/2.0;
33  int index = posOrigin + ceil((x-delta)/quantum);
34  return index;
35 }
36 
47 bool MCSimulation(miro_teleop::MonteCarlo::Request &req,
48  miro_teleop::MonteCarlo::Response &res)
49 {
50  int iters = 1000, batch = 1, max_x, max_y, count = 0;
51  float quantum = HSIZE/RES, sdx = RES, sdy = RES, rx, ry,
52  xmin=-HSIZE/2, xmax=HSIZE/2, ymin=-VSIZE/2, ymax=VSIZE/2;
53  float max_obj = 0, obj;
54 
55  // Obtain input request data
56  std_msgs::Float64 landscape[RES*RES];
57  for(int i=0;i<req.landscape.size();i++)
58  landscape[i].data = req.landscape[i].data;
59 
60  boost::mt19937 *rng = new boost::mt19937();
61 
62  rng->seed(time(NULL));
63 
64  // Uniform Distribution
65  boost::random::uniform_real_distribution<> distx(xmin, xmax);
66  boost::variate_generator< boost::mt19937,
67  boost::random::uniform_real_distribution<> > dx(*rng, distx);
68 
69  while(max_obj<PERT_THRESH)
70  {
71  for (int i = 1; i <= iters; i++)
72  {
73  rx=dx();
74  ry=dx();
75  std::cout<<"Random point generated at ("<<rx<<","<<
76  ry<<") ";
77  // Excluding points on and outside the boundary
78  if(rx>xmin && rx<xmax && ry>ymin && ry<ymax)
79  {
80  int ncols = ceil((xmax-xmin)/quantum);
81  int nrows = ceil((ymax-ymin)/quantum);
82  int index_x = quantize(rx, xmin, xmax, quantum);
83  int index_y = (nrows-1-quantize(ry, ymin, ymax,
84  quantum));
85  // Inverting to maintain mapping consistency
86  // with matrix formed by pertinence mapper
87  obj = landscape[index_y*ncols + index_x].data;
88  std::cout<<"val = "<<obj<<std::endl;
89  if(obj>1)
90  {
91  ROS_INFO("rx=%f, ry=%f, obj=%f, (%d,%d)\n",
92  rx, ry, obj, index_x, index_y);
93  }
94  if(obj>max_obj && obj<=1)
95  {
96  max_obj=obj;
97  max_x=rx;
98  max_y=ry;
99  }
100  }
101  }
102  count++;
103  if(count>=LIMIT)
104  {
105  ROS_INFO("Timeout: maximum number of rounds exceeded");
106  // Return out-of-bound numbers as a timeout flag
107  res.goal.x = 2*HSIZE;
108  res.goal.y = 2*VSIZE;
109  return true;
110  }
111  }
112 
113  res.goal.x = max_x;
114  res.goal.y = max_y;
115  ROS_INFO("Goal position: (%f,%f) with val=%f", res.goal.x, res.goal.y,
116  max_obj);
117  return true;
118 }
119 
124 int main(int argc, char **argv)
125 {
126  ros::init(argc, argv, "monte_carlo_server");
127  ros::NodeHandle n;
128  ros::ServiceServer service =
129  n.advertiseService("monte_carlo", MCSimulation);
130  ROS_INFO("Monte Carlo Simulation service active");
131  ros::spin();
132 
133  return 0;
134 }
